aws::graph::propositions: # Aviation Accident Analysis of Piaggio P180 Runway Excursion in Broomfield, Colorado
The accident occurred in Broomfield, Colorado.
The accident occurred on February 12, 2020, at 21:15 local time.
The accident involved a Piaggio P180 aircraft.
The defining event was a runway excursion.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation regulations.
The accident number was CEN20LA083.
The aircraft registration was N677P.
The Piaggio P180 aircraft sustained substantial damage.
Four people were on board the aircraft.
No injuries occurred in the accident.
The private pilot was making an instrument approach at night.
The approach was conducted in instrument meteorological conditions.
The control tower advised that packed snow was reported on the runway.
The control tower advised that moderate braking conditions were reported on the runway.
The pilot reported the approach was on speed.
The airplane initially touched down smoothly.
When the nosewheel touched down, the airplane yawed to the left.
The pilot's efforts to maintain directional control were not successful.
The airplane slid on the runway surface.
The airplane departed the left side of the runway.
The airplane spun around after departing the runway.
The right wing tip contacted the ground.
The canard contacted the ground.
The accident resulted in substantial damage to the right wing.
The accident resulted in substantial damage to the canard.
The accident resulted in substantial damage to the aileron.
Postaccident examination revealed both nose gear tires were deflated.
Postaccident examination revealed the right main tire had low air pressure.
The pilot did not report any pre-accident mechanical malfunction with the airplane.
The pilot did not report any pre-accident anomaly with the airplane that may have precluded normal operation.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of this accident to be the pilot's loss of directional control on the snow-covered runway.
The loss of directional control resulted in a runway excursion.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
Broomfield, Colorado

## Date & Time: 
February 12, 2020, 21:15 Local

## Aircraft:
Piaggio P180

## Defining Event:
Runway excursion

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation

## Accident Number:
CEN20LA083

## Registration:
N677P

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
4 None

## Analysis

The private pilot was making an instrument approach at night in instrument meteorological conditions. The control tower advised that packed snow and moderate braking were reported on the runway. The pilot reported that the approach was on speed and the airplane initially touched down smoothly. When the nosewheel touched down, the airplane yawed to the left, and the pilot's efforts to maintain directional control were not successful. The airplane slid on the surface, departed the left side of the runway, and spun around, then the right wing tip and canard contacted the ground, resulting in substantial damage to the right wing, canard, and aileron.

Postaccident examination revealed both nose gear tires were deflated, and the right main tire had low air pressure. However, the pilot did not report any pre-accident mechanical malfunction or anomaly with the airplane that may have precluded normal operation.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be:

The pilot's loss of directional control on the snow-covered runway, which resulted in a runway excursion.

---
